definition: to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
to walk (side part of split character)

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: First cannot the world compel or the child strikes the belly.
sentences.chinese: 首先不能坛迫或孩击肚子。

sentences.english: Mr Zamora says that changing the law is a "high priority".
sentences.chinese: 萨莫拉先生说，修改相关法律已经“迫在眉梢”。

sentences.english: They tried to starve me out by a sex-trap.
sentences.chinese: 他们妄图以女色迫我就范。

sentences.english: Applying forcing method, we show that both are consistent with ZFC, respectively.
sentences.chinese: 用力迫方法证明了它们分别相对于ZFC协调。

sentences.english: because you just don't have time to study until like you have to.
sentences.chinese: 因为不到迫不得的时候你根本没时间学习。
